HDateValue

HDateValues are HValue extensions used to support the special type of value of dates/times with special xml output and internal representanion as a numeric value representing seconds since 1970-1-1 It has the accompanying methods to set date parts, like months and hours.

Summary
HDateValue
HDateValues are HValue extensions used to support the special type of value of dates/times with special xml output and internal representanion as a numeric value representing seconds since 1970-1-1 It has the accompanying methods to set date parts, like months and hours.
constructor
We just need the id and value, as usual.
validate
Simple value validation
set
You should only set with values as arrays with three integers in range 0..255.
getYear
Returns the year of the specified date according to local time.
getMonth
Returns the month in the specified date according to local time.
getWeek
Returns the week in the specified date according to local time.
getMDay
Returns the day of the month for the specified date according to local time.
getHour
Returns the hour for the specified date according to local time.
getMinute
Returns the minute for the specified date according to local time.
getSecond
Returns the second for the specified date according to local time.
getTimeZone
Returns the time-zone offset in hours for the current locale.
setYear
Sets the full year for a specified date according to local time.
setMonth
Set the month for a specified date according to local time.
setMDay
Sets the day of the month for a specified date according to local time.
setHour
Sets the hour for a specified date according to local time.
setMinute
Sets the minute for a specified date according to local time.
setSecond
Sets the second for a specified date according to local time.
setTimeZone
setDateFormat
toDateString
Format the value as a nice human-readable string.
toXML
Generates an XML description of the date.

constructor

constructor: function(_id,
_value)

We just need the id and value, as usual.  However the value has to be a JavaScript Date object.

Parameters

_idSee HValue.constructor
_valueJavaScript Date object.

validate

validate: function(_value)

Simple value validation

Parameters

_valueJavaScript Date object.

set

set: function(_value)

You should only set with values as arrays with three integers in range 0..255.

getYear

getYear: function()

Returns the year of the specified date according to local time.

Returns

For dates between the years 1000 and 9999, getYear returns a four-digit number, for example, 1995.

getMonth

getMonth: function()

Returns the month in the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getMonth is an integer between 1 and 12.

getWeek

getWeek: function()

Returns the week in the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getWeek is an integer between 1 and 53.

getMDay

getMDay: function()

Returns the day of the month for the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getMDay is an integer between 1 and 31.

getHour

getHour: function()

Returns the hour for the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getHour is an integer between 0 and 23.

getMinute

getMinute: function()

Returns the minute for the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getMinute is an integer between 0 and 59.

getSecond

getSecond: function()

Returns the second for the specified date according to local time.

Returns

The value returned by getSecond is an integer between 0 and 59.

getTimeZone

getTimeZone: function()

Returns

Returns the time-zone offset in hours for the current locale.

setYear

setYear: function(_yearNum,
_monthNum,
_mdayNum)

Sets the full year for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_yearNumAn integer specifying the numeric value of the year, for example, 1995.
_monthNumAn integer between 1 and 12 representing the months January through December.
_mdayNumAn integer between 1 and 31 representing the day of the month.  If you specify the dayValue parameter, you must also specify the monthValue.

setMonth

setMonth: function(_monthNum,
_mdayNum)

Set the month for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_monthNumAn integer between 1 and 12.
_mdayNumAn integer from 1 to 31, representing the day of the month.

setMDay

setMDay: function(_mdayNum)

Sets the day of the month for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_mdayNumAn integer from 1 to 31, representing the day of the month.

setHour

setHour: function(_hourNum,
_minuteNum,
_secondNum,
_msNum)

Sets the hour for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_hourNumAn integer between 0 and 23, representing the hour.
_minuteNumAn integer between 0 and 59, representing the minute.
_secondNumAn integer between 0 and 59, representing the seconds.  If you specify the _secondNum parameter, you must also specify the _minuteNum.
_msNumA number between 0 and 999, representing the milliseconds.  If you specify the _msNum parameter, you must also specify the _minuteNum and _secondNum.

setMinute

setMinute: function(_minuteNum,
_secondNum,
_msNum)

Sets the minute for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_minuteNumAn integer between 0 and 59, representing the minute.
_secondNumAn integer between 0 and 59, representing the second.  If you specify the _secondNum parameter, you must also specify the _minuteNum.
_msNumA number between 0 and 999, representing the millisecond.  If you specify the _msNum parameter, you must also specify the _minuteNum and _secondNum.

setSecond

setSecond: function(_secondNum,
_msNum)

Sets the second for a specified date according to local time.

Parameters

_secondNumAn integer between 0 and 59.
_msNumA number between 0 and 999, representing the millisecond.

setTimeZone

setTimeZone: function(_theTimeZoneValue)

Parameters

_theTimeZoneNumNegative or positive numeric value that represents how many hours to add or subtract when making the value human-readable.

setDateFormat

setDateFormat: function(_reprString)

Parameters

_reprStringA string that represents date / time parts in the format the user wants them.

See Also

toDateString

toDateString

toDateString: function()

Format the value as a nice human-readable string.

dThe day of the month.  Single-digit days will not have a leading zero.
ddThe day of the month.  Single-digit days will have a leading zero.
MThe numeric month.  Single-digit months will not have a leading zero.
MMThe numeric month.  Single-digit months will have a leading zero.
MMMThe abbreviated name of the month
MMMMThe full name of the month
yThe year without the century.  If the year without the century is less than 10, the year is displayed with no leading zero.
yyThe year without the century.  If the year without the century is less than 10, the year is displayed with a leading zero.
yyyyThe year in four digits, including the century.
hThe hour in a 12-hour clock.  Single-digit hours will not have a leading zero.
hhThe hour in a 12-hour clock.  Single-digit hours will have a leading zero.
HThe hour in a 24-hour clock.  Single-digit hours will not have a leading zero.
HHThe hour in a 24-hour clock.  Single-digit hours will have a leading zero.
mThe minute.  Single-digit minutes will not have a leading zero.
mmThe minute.  Single-digit minutes will have a leading zero.
sThe second.  Single-digit seconds will not have a leading zero.
ssThe second.  Single-digit seconds will have a leading zero.
tThe first character in the AM/PM designator
ttThe AM/PM designator
zThe time zone offset (“+” or “-” followed by the hour only).  Single-digit hours will not have a leading zero.
zzThe time zone offset (“+” or “-” followed by the hour only).  Single-digit hours will have a leading zero.

See Also

setDateFormat

toXML

toXML: function(_i)

Generates an XML description of the date.

Parameter

_iThe sequence number of the item, generated by HValueManager.

Returns

An XML string with the date as specified

See Also

HValue.toXML HValueManager.toXML

Sample

<date id="date:215" order="1" epochvalue="1163153913.33" timezone="+2"><year>2006</year><month>11</month><mday>10</mday><hour>10</hour><minute>20</minute><second>23</second><timezone>+2</timezone></date>
Generated by Natural Docs
Data that needs to be syncronized between components or remote clients should be implemented as HValues.
